case_title: AKBAR ALI vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and others

accussed_details.name: Akbar Ali
allegation: Failure to pass intermediate school course required for promotion

complaint_summary: The appellant was reverted from the rank of A.S.I. to Head Constable due to failure in mandatory intermediate school course despite being granted accelerated promotion for extraordinary performance.
investigation_summary: The appellant was promoted to A.S.I. in 1990 for displaying extraordinary courage during duty, including apprehending a criminal while injured. He failed mandatory exams twice, leading to reversion by the Inspector-General of Police.

judgment_summary.decision: Accelerated promotion granted as a reward cannot be revoked due to failure in exams.
judgment_summary.principle: Rights conferred through accelerated promotion cannot be taken away later.
judgment_summary.appellant_status: Reinstated as A.S.I. with entitlement to back benefits.

Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted; appellant reinstated as A.S.I.
legal_arguments: Accelerated promotion granted in recognition of extraordinary service is exempt from ordinary rules.
Reversion based on failure to pass exams violates the principle of reward once conferred.
Rules of promotion do not explicitly address accelerated promotion but allow discretion for exceptional cases.
sections: Section 4 of Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974
key_issues: Applicability of mandatory exams for promoted officials
Recognition of extraordinary service in promotion decisions

maxims.Reward: A recompense or premium offered or bestowed by Government or an individual in return for special or extraordinary services.

legal_terms.Accelerated Promotion: Promotion granted by relaxing ordinary rules in recognition of extraordinary service.

words_and_phrases.Competent Authority: The authority empowered to make decisions regarding promotions and reversion.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the appellant's accelerated promotion to A.S.I. for extraordinary service, later revoked due to failure in mandatory exams. The court ruled that such promotions, being rewards for exceptional performance, cannot be withdrawn based on ordinary rules.

key_facts.promotion_to_head_constable: After passing Al and B1 examinations

issues.accelerated_promotion: Granted due to extraordinary performance and courage.
issues.reversion: Based on failure to pass intermediate school course exams.

arguments.appellant: Accelerated promotion was a reward for extraordinary performance and should not be subject to standard rules of promotion.
arguments.respondent: Promotion to A.S.I. requires passing mandatory courses as per Police Rules.
